_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (40 CFR 68.115(a))



The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are addressed in the RMP / PSM Implementation Program document which details the RMP / PSM program requirements as well as how Hilti will comply with the applicable requirements. The site is not a responding facility for releases of the RMP listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Action Plan.  



General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-specific Prevention Steps (40 CFR 68.115(c))



The Hilti DFW Warehouse is not required to implement the Program Level 3 prevention program requirements under the RMP regulations because they are eligible for RMP Program Level 1.  However, the Hilti DFW Warehouse is required to comply with the requirements for preventing or minimizing the consequences of catastrophic releases of flammable or explosive chemicals codified under the Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations (29 CFR 1910.119).  The required elements of the PSM prevention program are listed below:



-  Employee Participation

-  Process Safety Information

-  Process Hazard Analysis

-  Operating Procedures

-  Contractors

-  Pre-startup Safety Review

-  Mechanical Integrity

-  Hot Work Permit

-  Management of Change

-  Incident Investigation

-  Emergency Planning and Response

-  Compliance Audits



These items, their specific requirements, and how the Hilti DFW Warehouse will comply with the requirements are addressed in the RMP / PSM Implementation Program document.



Five-year Accident History (40 CFR 68.115(d))



The Hilti DFW Warehouse has had zero RMP reportable incidents in the previous five years.  



Emergency Response Program (40 CFR 68.115(e))



In the event of an aerosol-related emergency, Hilti will notify the Dallas Fire Department to respond and will evacuate their employees when needed.  Additional details related to emergency procedures can be located in the facility's emergen

cy action plan that is included in the RMP / PSM Implementation Program document.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety (40 CFR 68.115(f))



The facility completed a process hazard analysis in June 2016 which identified several recommendations for enhanced process safety.  These recommendations are summarized in the PHA report and are currently under evaluation.
